about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: 25+ Years of Excellence
about.text1: Simmons Civil Group Inc has been providing top-quality construction and utility services for over 25 years. Our commitment to excellence, safety, and client satisfaction sets us apart in the industry!
about.text2: We pride ourselves on building lasting relationships with our clients through reliable service, quality workmanship, and attention to detail on every project.

items.title: Sewer
items.description:
Installing and repairing sewer mains, laterals, and manholes

Setting precast structures, risers, and ductile iron or PVC pipe systems

Providing emergency repairs and system maintenance to keep flows moving properly

items.title: Water
items.description:
Installing and repairing water mains, service lines, and connections

Setting valves, hydrants, meters, and essential water system components

Performing emergency fixes and system upgrades to keep water flowing safely

items.title: Storm Water
items.description:
Installing and repairing drainage pipes, basins, and structures

Managing runoff with swales, flares, and grading for proper flow

Maintaining stormwater systems to prevent flooding and erosion

items.title: Grading
items.description:
Cutting, filling, and leveling land to proper elevations

Shaping terrain for drainage and site readiness

Preparing stable foundations for construction and utilities

gallery.title: Our Projects
gallery.subtitle: Take a look at some of our recent work

images.caption: Storm Water Pump Station Rehab. Consisting of installing a new pump, grading to proper elevations, installed a well-built riser for wetwell and adding a concrete flair for drainage.
Utility Installation. Installing ductile iron sewer pipe being set into a precast structure with proper stone bedding as part of an underground utility installation.
We provided full infrastructure work for a private development by installing the water, sewer, and storm systems for a retirement facility in North Raleigh.
Storm Water Pond Expansion. We expanded the stormwater pond by grading the slope, shaping the bottom to proper elevations, and finishing the area with sod, rip rap, and irrigation.
